unnormalised: **Brand Collabs: Still Ruling the Social Media Roost?**
normalised: Brand Collaborations: Still Ruling the Social Media Roost?

unnormalised: Okay, friends, let's talk brand collaborations! Are they still the *it* thing on Instagram and YouTube? Seems like every other post is #sponsored these days, right? From fashion hauls featuring Sarita's Boutique in Lucknow to food reviews hawking the latest biryani joint on Linking Road, influencers are cashing in.
normalised: Okay, friends, let us talk brand collaborations! Are they still the "it" thing on Instagram and YouTube? Seems like every other post is hash sponsored these days, right? From fashion hauls featuring Sarita's Boutique in Lucknow to food reviews hawking the latest biryani joint on Linking Road, influencers are cashing in.

unnormalised: We saw a massive spike during Diwali, but is the momentum continuing? There's been chatter online about "collab fatigue," with followers getting tired of constant ads.
normalised: We saw a massive spike during Diwali, but is the momentum continuing? There has been chatter online about "collab fatigue," with followers getting tired of constant ads.

unnormalised: However, brands are doubling down! Word on the street is that IIT-Bombay students are being targeted for tech gadget collaborations. Think detailed reviews of new laptops and coding software...all #ad, of course.
normalised: However, brands are doubling down! Word on the street is that I I T-Bombay students are being targeted for tech gadget collaborations. Think detailed reviews of new laptops and coding software...all hash ad, of course.

unnormalised: During Onam, we saw some really cool tie-ins featuring traditional Kerala sarees and homemade payasam. So, are collabs dead? Nah, just evolving. Smart brands are now focusing on authenticity and long-term partnerships. Expect to see more nano-influencers and hyper-local campaigns in 2024! Keep your eyes peeled, especially around the Rs. 20,000 - Rs. 50,000 price range, those are the sweet spot for brands right now! And remember to always check those #ad hashtags!
normalised: During Onam, we saw some really cool tie-ins featuring traditional Kerala sarees and homemade payasam. So, are collabs dead? Nah, just evolving. Smart brands are now focusing on authenticity and long term partnerships. Expect to see more nano-influencers and hyper-local campaigns in two thousand and twenty four! Keep your eyes peeled, especially around the rupee twenty thousand - rupee fifty thousand price range, those are the sweet spot for brands right now! And remember to always check those hash ad hashtags!
